model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
What instrument do you play? 
I don't know play instrument. Only  I enjoy rock music.
ah right, who's your favourite rock band?
I'm big fan of aerosmith. When do you learn music. Whom teach you?
aerosmith are great, have you ever seen them live? I have been playing drums since i was a kid, my father taught me when I was young and from then on I just taught myself
That's awesome! I have been trying to learn last one year. Still I didn't get right teacher. I'm jealous on you. I don't have like your dad.
what instrument have you been trying to learn?
Piano is my favorite instrument. When try play my mind was mesmerizing. How do you learn surfering?
I learnt to surf from one of my good friends, he surfed in a number of competitions and did very well. Would you like to learn to surf if you had more time?
Yes, I would like to learn surfing with my friends at weekend. But my friends didn't have interesting on surfing.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Music and Concerts', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A talks about being in a band and planning a concert in Denver, while Speaker B shares interest in live music.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: How many people are in your band? ### Speaker A: 4. The singer is my best friend. I write the songs and he sings them. ### Speaker B: Neat. You must have been a good student at writing. ### Speaker A: That was the only subject I was good in!. ### Speaker B: I understand! I was bad at math. I preferred fishing. ### Speaker A: My band booked a concert in Denver. ### Speaker B: That is really awesome. I should take a trip there to watch you play. ### Speaker A: You totally should! Have you been to many small concerts before?' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Travel and Cuisine', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A shares experiences of touring Italy with the band, while Speaker B discusses a passion for cooking Italian dishes.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: No worries! I am very passionate about cooking. I got a new recipe book for my birthday in May, so we could try it out. Is there any food you are allergic to?  ### Speaker A: I am allergic to strawberries.  I don't think that should be too hard to avoid.  What are your favorite things to cook?   ### Speaker B: I love Italian food! I like cooking pasta, risotto, and I'm getting better at making pizza all by myself. Have you every been to Italy or tried Italian dishes?  ### Speaker A: My band toured Italy last fall.  We spend 6 weeks at different towns and bars.  We seem to have a bit of a following there.  The food was amazing!' }
```
